content: froggybug seahorse english version v3 as most of my patterns this project is built-in when the knitting is done there is no sewing to do they don t require much wool but a lot of time to make suggested yarns abbreviations drops fabel with 2mm needles dpn double pointed needle k knit kb knit from back loop gauge kfb knit through front loop then back loop this makes if you wish to use a thicker yarn for your project it will 2 stitches from 1 just become bigger but in the exact same proportions k2tog knit 2 together this makes 1 stitch from 2 as mine p purl the gauge is not important as long as the fabric is p2tog purl 2 together this makes 1 stitch from 2 tight enough that the stuffing won t show through s slip purl wise i use needles that are 2 sizes smaller than size sko slip knit one pass slipped stitch over this recommended on ball band makes 1 from 2 needles and other required items for drops fabel recommended needles size is 3mm st stitch / stitches * a circular needle 2mm for the sides and the tail as and i use 2mm yb yarn in the back there are over 40 stitches yf yarn in the front * a set of 5 dpn 2mm yo yarn over * 1 crochet hook for the eyes w wrap * 1 tapestry needle - if the previous stitch was knit s1 purl wise yb turn * soft toy stuffing for the head and tail the work and s1 *** a lot of patience *** - if the previous stitch was purled s1 purl wise yf turn the work and s1 required techniques high level process description garter stitch for belly seahorse starts from the belly in garter stitch there is a slot in to let the egg in and purled stitches to mark the ridges out short row for the tail the tail is knit in garter stitch with some short row increases and decreases to add button hole yarn over knit 2 together some volume the two edges are joined together using the 3 needles bind off hole for the egg slot cast off x stitches and cast on x stitches on the next process row the right side starts with picking stitches from the belly and half of the tail the tail picking up stitches from the side this is used quite a lot as a built-in project will join to the body whilst progressing the side knit-in-the round using double pointed needles or circular needle for the the left side is knit symetrically to the right one head the top of the two sides are joined by knitting the coronet with 8 spikes matching 3-needle knit together to join the tops of the sides and knit the coronet the ridges 3-needle bind off to join the tail edges together without sewing the technic the head is knit in the round
